atDirectives.name: @starting-style
atDirectives.description: The `@starting-style` CSS at-rule is used to define starting values for properties set on an element that you want to transition from when the element receives its first style update, i.e. when an element is first displayed on a previously loaded page.

atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the `@tailwind` directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities` and `screens` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use the `@apply` directive to inline existing utility classes into your custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @responsive
atDirectives.description: You can generate responsive variants of your own classes by wrapping their definitions in the `@responsive` directive.

atDirectives.name: @variants
atDirectives.description: Generate `hover`, `focus`, `active` and other variants of your own utilities by wrapping their definitions in the `@variants` directive.
